ELA was recognized by UMLA this month! We received the Utah Middle Level Team of the Year!!!

This recognition is given annually to several teams of teachers, counselors, or school personnel who demonstrate the essential elements of middle level philosophy, which include student advocacy, interdisciplinary curriculum, team planning, and collaboration. Exemplary activities recognized could be those of student support, parent involvement, curriculum integration, team activities, service projects, transition activities, and/or student recognition.

Way to go ELA!!!!!!

We have such an awesome school! Tell all of your friends and neighbors to get into the lottery, which is now open for the 2020-2021 school year!

Are you looking for a job? We have openings in our cafeteria!

We are seeking someone to join our team! We are looking to hire a 5 day a week person to work Monday to Friday. The job entails, preparing fruits, vegetables, breads, main dish and other items, in a fast pace kitchen, working with the other amazing Child Nutrition Professionals, be on your feet the whole time, have some basic computer and math skills, be able to follow instructions, have knife skills, have a food handlers permit, follow school policy and health codes. Work as part of a team to help get things set and ready in the morning for the lunch service. Be able to interact with the amazing students and help create a positive lunch experience for our students. We are seeking someone dependable, motivated and happy. The pay is $10-10.65 a hour DOE, and will follow the same schedule as the school calendar. If you are interested in applying, please email dhirst@ascentutah.org.

Dave HirstCNP DirectorAscent Academies of Utah

We are so impressed by the number of students that were able to meet their Math goal of 50% or more in STMath, ALEKS, and Math XL. Since we had so many students complete this goal, we will be having 2 different reward dates. Student in grades k-2 will be given a wristband signifying that they have met the goal and will get to wear their pajamas on Tuesday, January 30. The will also participate in a craft with Mrs. Young and Mrs. Berry. On Thursday, February 1, students in grades 3-9 will be able to wear their pajamas, with their wristband, and attend a special pie assembly with Mrs. Young, Mr. Alder, Mrs. Beach, Mrs. Berry, and other special guests.
